body.p: Since the UNIX manual has such a rich history of development, it would be strange were it not to have a significant body of supporting tools for composition. In fact, the First Edition of UNIX was bundled with a set of tools, the UNIX Writer's Workbench, specifically for composing documents — spell-checking, grammar-checking, editing, and so forth.

These tools are, sadly, no longer distributed with most UNIX systems. Even the topic of spell-checking is no longer standardised. However, the situation isn't so grim: the vi editor is stipulated by POSIX.1-2008. And although a spell-checker is not, there are several widely-distributed spell-checkers available.
One of the best parts of mdoc is that none of these specific tools are necessary: an mdoc document is just a text file and may be composed in any editor.
